attributes.action: Total ban on killing and eating of dogs and cats in uk
attributes.background: Total ban and new legislation to make the killing of cats and dogs for the purpose of food consumption illegal in the UK. The current law is that it is illegal to sell dog meat through licensed channels to the public, but actually eating dog and cat meat is not a specifically banned practice in UK.
attributes.additional_details: Daily mail article dated 6th August 2018

attributes.action: Ban the use of disposable plastics, plastic toys  & plastic bags in the UK.
attributes.background:
According to World Environmental Forum, we have become too depended on using plastics.
More than 8 million tons of it ends up in the ocean every year. If we continue to pollute at this rate, there will be more plastic than fish in the ocean by 2050.”
attributes.additional_details:
As a mother of 2 young children I feel now is the time to #endplasticuse4good.
I travelled to Kenya recently and I was surprised to discover that they have banned the use of plactic bags and so on.
We MUST all take action now to save our planet. Please support this petition!
The toy companies must be accountable and be charged for making plastic toys that are easily disposable!

attributes.action: Make Escort Vehicles Carry Highways Agency Code Of Practice Mandatory.
attributes.background:
I would like the Highways Agency Code of Practice for Escort Vehicles markings and lighting made mandatory.
I am increasingly observing so called Escort Vehicles without adequate safety warning markings front or rear including width of vehicle lighting.
I doubt they are fully insured or equipped.
attributes.additional_details:
What I am describing does not make a good Escort Operator but does bring a more safety conscious driver to the mind of the motoring public therefore safety becomes more paramount. If you like, wearing a uniform describes our profession at a glance. 
There are many of us who adhere to this practice including the equipment we should be carrying for emergency or breakdown and can be found on social media where we share some experiences.

attributes.action: Require a minimum 30 minute rest break in a 12-hour shift by law
attributes.background: You are entitled to one rest break of 20 mins if you are employed for more than six hours a day. Therefore, even on a 12-hour shift, you are only legally entitled to ONE 20 mins rest break. This Petition is asking Parliament to change the law, to require a longer break time.
attributes.additional_details:
Andrew Griffiths MP, Minister for Small Business, Consumers & Corporate Responsibility replied on 7 June 2018 to my MP's letter: 
"We keep all our employment regulations under review, including the Working Time Regulations (WTR) 1998 which contain the statutory requirements on rest breaks. 

We currently have no plans to review these provisions, the WTR represent the minimum requirements and employers are free to offer more generous terms to their workers through their employment contracts".

attributes.action: The cost of a colour TV licence should be cut to £100.
attributes.background:
BBC news and current affairs programmes are no longer of high quality.
In an age of austerity where ordinary people are struggling to make ends meet, a licence fee of £150 is no longer justified for substandard broadcasting.
attributes.additional_details:
As a national broadcaster, the BBC is expected to be fearless, objective and impartial in its reporting of news and current affairs programming.
The BBC often avoids or downplays politically sensitive news items, allows statements to go unchallenged and uses false equivalence to counter balance expert opinion.
These are not the attributes expected of a national broadcaster in a leading democratic nation.

attributes.action: Set up a Citizens' Assembly for public engagement at Parliament
attributes.background:
Public Engagement is seen to be in distress, with a feeling of disconnect and distrust between voters and House of Commons

We ask that a representative sample of the electorate is invited with remuneration to engage with issues and MPs at Parliament, and make recommendations on current affairs
attributes.additional_details:
Citizens' Assembly Ireland: https://www.citizensassembly.ie/en/

Sortition Foundation: https://www.sortitionfoundation.org/what_is_sortition

Lecture by Prof. James Fishkin: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=27tVMj6YUNM

FT article on David Van Reybrouck: https://www.ft.com/content/03f34228-4e72-11e6-8172-e39ecd3b86fc

attributes.action: Prevent absent parents from travelling outside the UK if maintenance is unpaid
attributes.background: Recently Australia enforced action against parents with child support debts from travelling in and out of the country until they had settled their arrears. Introducing a similar law into the UK would benefit many UK families and make absent parents face up to their responsibilities.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/may/27/child-support-debts-record-number-of-parents-prevented-from-travelling-overseas

attributes.action: Alll people charged with a sexual offence against children remanded in custody.
attributes.background: Children are our future. The most valuable people in society. If the CPS deems enough evidence to charge offenders exist, that means they are a danger to all children. Which means they should be on remand until their court case. No bail can circumvent this risk. No prison spaces? Build new prisons.

attributes.action: Make EV charging as easy as filling up with petrol/diesel fuel.
attributes.background: Make all charging stations accept credit or debit cards or maybe cash with no prior membership. The cost per kWh should also be displayed in the same way as fuel prices are displayed on forecourts. EV uptake will be significantly improved if owners know they can easily charge anywhere.
attributes.additional_details: To charge an EV currently requires one to be a member of a variety of different clubs with different schemes and maybe club cards in order to access charging power points. I usually charge at home but recently tried charging at a charging point but failed. I had installed Polar instants on my phone with credit but either I didn't have mobile data access or the polar servers weren't working but I was unsuccessful. Fortunately I just had enough charge to limp home.

attributes.action: Lower Company Car Tax (BIK) on all company cars
attributes.background: Fewer people are now paying company car tax but the Government takes in excess of £360m extra revenue,funds from company car drivers has increased by 24% each year. WLTP is going to make some cars go up in bandings despite the EU dictating that the driver should not have to pay more until April2020.
attributes.additional_details: The latest figures published in fleet news is bad news for company car drivers and car dealers alike.  Drivers have seen tax hikes like no other and are often middle earners, not high earners.

attributes.action: More equality for owner occupiers in claims for support for mortgage interest
attributes.background: When people make a claim within universal credit for help with owner occupier housing costs (support for mortgage interest) there is a 39 week wait, 9 assessment periods. Also if they earn even 1 penny they cannot receive any help. Any help they do get is now a loan.
attributes.additional_details: This is inconsistent with support for tenants. The housing element for rental costs can be paid within weeks and people are allowed to work and still get the support. Before transferring to universal credit people could get help with mortgage interest and still do permitted work whilst receiving employment and support allowance, for example. https://www.gov.uk/support-for-mortgage-interest; https://www.gov.uk/housing-and-universal-credit

attributes.action:
Allow a 
Referendum on changing the House Of Lords to a fully Elected Chamber
attributes.background: Abolition of the House of Lords has been debated. No clear way forward to address people’s concerns was forthcoming; though their was some acknowledgement of it overstepping it’s remit, particularly to thwart the people’s decision for Brexit. The chamber needs to better reflect people’s wishes.
attributes.additional_details: An elected chamber, drawn from all walks of life and being fully representative of the electorate should replace the current system. There should not be allowed to be overwhelming numbers from one particular political party or persuasion. Elected members should not need to be past MPs and could be experts in their field - elected to scrutinise in particular areas. People need to be able to trust that the powers given to scrutinise are not abused, nor guided by personal agenda or preference.

attributes.action: Introduce a Licencing system for cyclists and tighten up cycle law.
attributes.background:
Recently a facebook post caused horror and cyclists regularly show little regard for other road users and the law.

Please debate introducing a licence, at least with theory tests similar to other vehicles, which all cyclists must pass and must carry at all times and have 3rd party insurance.
attributes.additional_details:
I once received verbal abuse from a cyclist feeling I was in the wrong. I had dash cam footage reviewed by the police who were horrified how many highway code points the cyclist broke. The cyclist could not be traced so no action was taken but it's typical of the lack of knowledge of cyclists.

I am a horse rider, cyclist, motorcyclist, and car driver. The group I see least consideration for road users and frequent law breaking is cyclists.

attributes.action: Prohibit the manafacture and commercial distribution of cigarettes within the UK
attributes.background:
Ever hour around the world, 800 people die as a result of the most lethal human creation - cigarettes. These small paper rolls kill more people on average around the globe than AK47's

So why is it so ironic that countries prohibit smoking in public but still allow toxic tobacco manufacturing ?
attributes.additional_details:
There are more than 4 million hectares of deforestation for cigarette fuels and paper wrapping.

This industry kills 7 million people ever year

So why can we as humans not recognise that this substance would be better off if completely irradicated. Why is it seen as though the manafacturers care more about their profits than the health of people around the globe. 

And unfortunately, "smoking kills" just isn't enough.

attributes.action: Require Parliamentary Approval before Ratifying Treaties or MOUs
attributes.background:
An Act of Parliament is required which provides that: 
a. Ratification is no longer a prerogative power 
b. the treaty text must be laid before parliament for 3 months 
c. an order to ratify must then be laid under affirmative procedure whereby both houses have to vote yes, or it fails.
attributes.additional_details: Allowing ratification without thorough parliamentary scrutiny and the final say surely weakens the hand of the UK negotiators. I believe that the only rational motive for Dr Fox being allowed to ratify the deal with the US unchallenged would be to allow him to do something that the British public would not approve of, e.g. to hasten the destruction of the NHS.

attributes.action: Stop the creation of any further unelected peers
attributes.background: The Prime Minister is attempting to create 10 new peers to help ensure the government does not get defeated in the House of Lords. This is an abuse of the system. I suggest we create no further peers and start to vote them in. This way we can transition to an elected second house and stop cronyism.
attributes.additional_details: The existing peers will retain their positions but as the resign/die their seat will then be up for election.

attributes.action: Increase funding for research into pancreatic cancer
attributes.background: Pancreatic cancer is one of the hardest to catch, even if caught eairly enough still over 90% of patients die within a year. I want to ensure that more research money is allocated to help find better treatment as well as diognoses to ensure more people have a better chance of survival -1% at the min
attributes.additional_details: See pancreatic cancer charity for more information

attributes.action: Scrap the 2 child limit on the benefits system
attributes.background: Limiting the children in the benefit system to 2 only. is causing unfair hardship on families.Some single mothers have absent fathers. who if forced to pay out benefits can pay as little as £1.50 pw, with no government help. how can this be fair upon the child they abandoned..

attributes.action: Increase the maintenance loan for all students, regardless of parental income.
attributes.background: The maintenance loan is designed to help students with the cost of living, however for certain students it doesn't even cover accommodation costs as the loan is reduced for those students whose parents have certain incomes. I argue this should be increased to a minimum of £10,000 for all students.
attributes.additional_details: This is because, even if your parents earn £40,000 which is above the £27,000 average salary, they may still be tied into a mortgage and with interest rates rising, they can't just find extra money to fund their children's university living expenses. Therefore, if the maintenance loan was increases to at least £10,000 for all students, those whose parents earn slightly more but don't have a lot more disposable income will not be as disadvantaged and will have improved quality of life.

attributes.action: Give all UK citizens the right to a non-binding vote on parliamentary debates.
attributes.background:
Citizens already have the right to view almost all parliamentary debates online. 

Add a simple voting mechanism for the public to vote.

Build digital infrastructure on parliament.uk which allows those with UK citizenship a non-binding vote (‘aye’/‘no’/abstain) on all debates in parliament.
attributes.additional_details:
This is a crude solution to the issue of representative democracy versus direct democracy in the UK. 

Many citizens feel as though a vote on who should represent them in parliament every five years isn’t democratic enough.

If you think the proposed system
is better than the current system, sign this petition.

attributes.action: All local authorities should recycle all plastic
attributes.background: Torridge and West Devon do not currently allow recycling of anything other than plastic bottles. All other plastic is sent to landfill. In a joined up world how can it be that other Councils can recycle all plastic and others can only recycle some.
attributes.additional_details: Surely we should have a joined up approach to recycling ALL waste, particularly all plastic. Each council should adhere to a national recycling standard where all plastic is sent to be recycled. Economies of scale would make this more feasible rather than individual councils negotiating their own recycling schemes.

attributes.action: Free prescription charges in England
attributes.background:
Why should people in England be charged for prescriptions?
Why can the rest of the "United Kingdom" be exempt the same as Wales Scotland, Northern Ireland.
This is direct discrimination against anyone living in England.

attributes.action: Create a UK disabled/pensioner's bus pass that works across the whole UK.
attributes.background: Create a bus pass, like in Scotland/England/Wales where disabled and elderly people can travel for free but make it so that it works across the whole UK, not cutting out at a certain place because it's in a different part of the UK or not working because you are not in the country your you live in.
attributes.additional_details: For example a bus pass from Scotland not working in England/Wales or Vice Versa.  A whole UK one instead or as well as so it works everywhere and borders aren't an issue.

attributes.action: Issue a statement condemning democratic rights violations in Poland and Hungary
attributes.background: The Polish and Hungarian governments have undermined democracy in their respective countries. Poland has compromised the independence of the judiciary, while Hungary has restricted freedom of the press and the funding of pro-democracy NGOs. The UK Government should speak out against this.
attributes.additional_details: As evidence, we can note that the EU commission has begun proceedings against both countries due to Hungary’s violations of citizens’ rights under the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights, and Poland’s violation of the rule of law under Article 2 of the Treaty on European Union. The UK Government remains silent on the issue, when it should act to protect democracy in Europe for the sake of peace, prosperity, and justice.

attributes.action: Free Prescriptions for all under 25s in full time education
attributes.background: It is currently free for full time students aged 18 and under to get prescription medication. I’ve just turned 19 and will now have to pay for my medication whilst being a full time university student, so it may become that I cannot afford it every month and forfeit my health due to financial issues
attributes.additional_details: Many students may not see their gp due to this. I think that a valid student ID should give exemption to paying for prescriptions when being a first time student. The age limit needs raising from 18 to 25 to account for this.

attributes.action: Change the law and policy concerning box junctions.
attributes.background: If you stop in a box junction you are breaking the law and will receive a fine. There should be advance road sign warnings, and visual help to indicate how much space is after the junction. Drivers should be given more leniency if a vehicle enters the junction by 2 meters.

attributes.action: Introduce Emotional Assistance Pet Act to prevent suicides and help families!
attributes.background:
The legislation that allows the emotional support animal access in housing facilities, even when the complex has a no pet policy already exists in the US. So literally we are not discovering an America here.
The petition is simply a trigger for Parliament to introduce it into the UK legislation.
attributes.additional_details:
It is known that the highest rates of suicide are associated with depressive disorders. 

The human-animal emotional bond does not differ from the one that we sustain in relation to close family members i.e. our own children.

There is also Article 8 of the Human Rights Act that provides the right to respect for one’s established family life (no pre-determined model of a family or family life)

Being cut off from your pet (family member) is increasing the risk of depression.
http://eap-uk.org/

attributes.action: Make 11/11/2018 a non-trading day in remembrance of the First World War
attributes.background: There have been global commemorations to acknowledge the debt owed by all of us to all those affected by the terrible events of World War One. The Centenary of the ending of WW1 falls on Sunday 11/11/18. there can be a no better way to show our respect by ceasing all trading on that day.

attributes.action: Provide help for residents of Tawergha in Libya
attributes.background: There are around 35,000 people (who are an ethnic minority) who have been forced to leave their homes in the 2011 revolution by militias from Misrata. The UN-backed Tripoli Government promised their return to Tawargha on the 1st of February 2018, after 7 years of living in bad conditions.
attributes.additional_details: The militias have refused this government decision and blocked the roads to Tawergha by force. Now the people of Tawergha have built make-shift camps in Gararat Al-Gadaf which is near Bin Walid and Harawa which is near Sirte. On 5/02/2018 militias from Mistrata attacked the camp and burned some tents. On 12/02/2018 two people passed away and some children were admitted to Bin Walid hospital due to exposure to the cold. I am asking the British Government to provide assistance to these civilians.

attributes.action: The penalty for using a mobile phone while driving  1year ban and £500 fine.
attributes.background: Too many people are being injured and killed on our roads the present penalties are not a deterrent. Too many people are ignoring the issue.

attributes.action: Parents should have the right to choose who looks after their children.
attributes.background: Parents do not have the right to pay a trusted friend to look after their children.
attributes.additional_details: For low earners without family around them, and with childcare costs so high, a lot of parents end up having to work night shifts so the other parent can look after the children. Not a healthy situation for any family!

attributes.action: Encourage the public to let paramedics on lunch break to skip lines in shops
attributes.background: Resources for the emergency services are being stretched already. Some paramedics work 12 hour shifts, and get from 15 minute to 45 minute breaks. However, demand often outstrips available ambulances, and a lot of paramedics voluntarily stop their break earlier to get to a life threatened patient.
attributes.additional_details:
The West Midlands Ambulance Service state that in a huge majority of cases, "ambulance crews will voluntarily stop their breaks in order to get to immediately life threatened patients quickly". 

Source: https://wmas.nhs.uk/about-wmas/patient-safety/nhs-ambulance-service-rest-and-meal-breaks/

The Government should make a campaign to encourage the public to let paramedics skip queues in shops while they are on their break.

attributes.action: To dedicate more resources to help men and young boys with mental health issues
attributes.background: As a young man, I’m scared to see statistics about male suicides. It is shocking that very little is being done to tackle the problem of mental health, and more needs to be done to help men and young boys with depression, anxiety and stress among with other issues
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.samaritans.org/about-us/our-research/facts-and-figures-about-suicide

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/thinking-man/11787304/Homelessness-is-a-gendered-issue-and-it-mostly-impacts-men.html

https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/birthsdeathsandmarriages/deaths/bulletins/suicidesintheunitedkingdom/2016registrations#main-points

attributes.action: Set a legal limit on the acceptable temperature for public transport of humans
attributes.background: With death tolls in Japan this week because of soaring temperatures doesn’t the UK government think it is important to set a legal limit on what is an acceptable temperature for the public transport of humans.
attributes.additional_details: People in the UK have had to endure temperatures on the Central Line, Northern Line and from other rail operators in excess of 40 degrees. This temperature is above the legal limit for the transport of cattle and other animals, why should we as humans be any worse off. I ask the UK government to act swiftly, invest properly with Air con installation throughout all networks and bottled water provided free to all passengers during Summer months.

attributes.action: Emergency services to be exempt from parking tickets or charges while on duty.
attributes.background:
Emergency services to be exempt from parking tickets or charges.

Lights and/or siren not required to be active for exemption.

Only requirement is for staff to be on duty (on call) but not restricted to being on a call and is to include brake times.
attributes.additional_details: www.express.co.uk/news/uk/993969/parking-warden-ticket-paramedics-north-west-ambulance-service/amp

attributes.action: Scrap the current school grading system and give us a result out of 100 (%).
attributes.background: Every year we get exam and test results for our children that are seemingly meaningless. The results don't tell us how much of the subject material they have actually learnt. If your child achieves a level 4C in Science, how much of the curriculum do they really know? Half? Three quarters? Who knows
attributes.additional_details: I propose two things: 1) that all tests are graded out of 100% and 2) that individual targets are scrapped. By giving us parents a simple percentage, you will be able to easily see how much of the subject your child actually knows. If they get a result of 65%, you can then decide if that's good enough for their ability or if you want them to work toward a higher grade.

attributes.action: Brexit re article 50 it must not be suspended/stopped under any circumstances
attributes.background: the full details are well known to everyone the media has covered it fully
attributes.additional_details: the british people MUST be given the Brexit they voted for anything else is not acceptable to the british public  ARTICLE 50 must not under any circumstances be hindered/suspended/stopped for any reason whatsoever  the time is here to take action as there has been excessive feet dragging/delaying tactics by those opposed to brexit

attributes.action: Give Transport for London the suburban metro rail services
attributes.background: In December 2016, the Transport Secretary, Chris Grayling refused to give the Mayor of London, Sadiq Khan the Southeastern, Southern and South Western metro rail services to Transport for London which would give a better service to passengers
attributes.additional_details: Patrick McLoughlin, Grayling's predecessor came to an agreement with Boris Johnson who was Mayor of London at that time that Transport for London should take over the Southeastern, Southern and South West metro line services when their contracts ended. The efficient running of the London Overground service highlights the considerable improvements to the reliability and quality of services that could be achieved for passengers if Transport for London were allowed to run the franchises.

attributes.action: Make gay conversion therapy a criminal offence
attributes.background:
Gay conversion therapy is currently legal in the UK

No one should be told that their sexual orientation, their identity, is a an illness that needs to be cured.
attributes.additional_details:
Following a journalist's report on gay conversion therapy at a church in Liverpool the government has devised a 75 point action plan to improve the lives of the LGBT community. The plan states that the government will set out to ban such therapies but doesn't say how this is going to be enforced.

You can't simply just tell people not to do something and hope that it works, because it doesn't. Something more needs to be done. We urge the government to criminalise gay conversion therapy.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of single-use, portable BBQs
attributes.background: Disposable single-use BBQs encourage people into the countryside during good weather but recent coverage of large scale moorland fires this year illustrates their incompatibility with responsible countryside use. Using BBQ in hot, dry weather is simply not worth the risk to nature, property or life.
attributes.additional_details: This summer's significant national media coverage of moorland wildfires across the UK

attributes.action: I want Government to create a law so Ayahuasca can be used legally in the UK
attributes.background:
It is a very helpful tool in allowing an individual who feels they want to explore themselves deeper and promotes healing; physically/ physchologically & spiritually. 
Ayahuasca promotes acceptance and resistance, giving power to the individual to decide, what is for them, their best way of being.
attributes.additional_details:
With facilitators supervising space, this provides a safe opportunity to experience the medicine

It is the use of Banisteriopsis caapi. 
A brew of B. caapi & P. viridis is the traditional South American brew. The caapi is particularly important as traditionally the caapi itself is considered to be “ayahuasca” while the DMT-containing plants are simply helpers.

Ayahuasca, also known as yage, is a blend of two plants - the ayahuasca vine and a shrub called chacruna (Psychotria viridis)

attributes.action: Provide special constables with a right to time off work to undertake duties
attributes.background: There is no right to unpaid time off work to undertake duties as a special constable.  Other public duties benefit from this right such as magistrates and council members. Special constables patrol side by side with paid police officers undertaking the same duties and tasks but on a voluntary basis.
attributes.additional_details:
Section 50(1) of the Employment Rights Act 1996 provides:

"An employer shall permit an employee of his who is a justice of the peace to take time off during the employee’s working hours for the purpose of performing any of the duties of his office."

The petitioner proposes a simple amendment to the Act:  after "justice of the peace" insert "or a special constable".  This would provide recognition to thousands of special constables in the country, providing them with the right to undertake their duties.

attributes.action: Award ten bank holiday's to England/Wales.
attributes.background:
England/Wales get 8 bank holidays, Scotland get 9 and Northern Ireland get 10.

The government should take into consideration that we need more bank holidays in order to have more personal and family time as we have the right to a private and family life and more bank holidays will help with this!

attributes.action: Licence possession of all knives that have potential to harm.
attributes.background: Our licensing laws forbid guns in our drawers, so why can't our government push for a change? License the manufacturing and possession of potential weapons. Rounded edge knives only unless licensed.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum for permitting assisted dying for terminally ill individuals.
attributes.background: The public opinion is in favour of allowing assisted dying for the terminally ill but the Parliament consistently opposes this.

attributes.action: Yarl's Wood should be closed down as unfit for purpose.
attributes.background: Hunger strikes, women put on planes in their nighties, children being reclassified as over 18.  This is a national shame.  Yarl's Wood has been an open sore for years now, the Sky News story,  'Immigration Centre Detainees 'treated like pigs'", 2/5/18 is one in a long line of stories
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/yarls-wood-inside-experience-hunger-strike-immigration-detention-scandal-a8230056.html

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/children-fleeing-warzones-being-locked-up-at-yarls-wood-detention-centre-investigation-finds-10337409.html

https://www.independent.co.uk/voices/windrush-generation-scandal-shappi-khorsandi-i-applaud-david-lammy-a8313906.html

attributes.action: Stop all councils from using enforcement agencies, bailiffs and threats of court
attributes.background: Council tax and poverty don't mix! If you are unable to pay on time you will be put into debt by your council. Theres no communication with customers they pass your bill to enforcement agencies with added fees,threats of ballifs,court and jail. If you believe this shouldn't be happening please sign.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for cyclists to overtake on the nearside of traffic
attributes.background:
There have recently been several cyclist deaths due to traffic turning left and not seeing the cyclist. This is a preventable by stopping cyclists from coming up the nearside of vehicles.
Stopping this behaviour will save lives.

attributes.action: Make the uk armed forces pensions tax free.
attributes.background: The current U.K. Armed forces pensions, is taxable, other services are non taxable, this should be addressed and made fair across the public sector.

attributes.action: Allow police to confiscate mobile phones when drivers are caught using them.
attributes.background: Fining drivers for mobile phone use appears to be of little deterrent on its own. A fine along with points on the license and immediate confiscation could possibly have more impact. The inconvenience and cost of losing all personal contacts and data would, for some people, be immeasurable.
attributes.additional_details: Lincolnshire recently had a blitz on catching drivers using mobile phones, as far as I can see that made absolutely no difference. I see the same people day in day out driving while using hand held mobile phones, that includes tractor drivers.
